::English::
===========
Original title: The Little Foxes
Year: 1941
Nationality: USA. UU.
Director: William Wyler
Cast: Bette Davis, Teresa Wright, Herbert Marshall, Patricia Collinge, Dan Duryea, Charles Dingle
Screenplay: Lillian Hellman (based on his own play)
Music: Meredith Willson
Photography: Gregg Toland
Studio: Metro Goldwyn Mayer
Length: 116 minutes
Awards: Nominated for eight Oscars, including Best Picture, Best Director, Best Actress (Bette Davis) and Best Supporting Actress (Teresa Wright).


Synopsis:
---------
Action takes place in the late nineteenth century in a small town in the southern United States.
Regina Giddens (Bette Davis), along with his two brothers, Ben (Charles Dingle) and Oscar (Carl Benton Reid), unscrupulous individuals decide to implement the dream of his life, raise a large cotton mill carried by cheap labor and which will become even richer. Needing $ 75,000 to buy a stake in a company which they see as their brothers, to win millions, Regina sends his daughter Alexandra (Teresa Wright) to Baltimore to bring her husband Horace (Herbert Marshall), a local banker who has been recovering from a heart attack in a sanatorium. Ben and Oscar conspiring with her sister Regina, to get her husband to invest in the business, since he is the true master of his fortune. But could not get money from Horace Regina, his nephew Leo (Dan Duryea), used in Horace bank, steal the safe-marketable bonds sufficient to ensure the financing of the machinery for cotton.
